intro: Orbea gilbertii, commonly known as Gilbert's orbea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in arid conditions. Orbea gilbertii is well adapted to dry environments and requires minimal water once established.
